ABANDONED.Defintion: left in a particular place or condition, usually forever

ASTRONAUTS.Defintion: people who have been trained for travelling in space

AWKWARD.Defintion: difficult to use, do, or deal with, embarrassing

BARE.Defintion: without any clothes or not covered by anything

CONCENTRATED.Defintion: using a lot of effort to succeed at one particular thing

DAWN.Defintion: the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky, the start of

DEVICE.Defintion: an object or machine that has been invented for a particular purpose

DISTILLING.Defintion: to make a liquid stronger or purer by heating it until it changes to a gas and then cooling it so that it changes back into a liquid

EUREKA.Defintion: used to show that you have been successful in something you were trying to do

FLUFFY.Defintion: soft and like wool or fur

FUR.Defintion: the thick hair that covers the bodies of some animals, or the hair-covered skin(s) of animals, removed from their bodies

HOLLOW.Defintion: having a hole or empty space inside

HOOKS.Defintion: a curved device used for catching or holding things, especially one attached to a surface for hanging things on

LABORATORIES.Defintion: a room or building with scientific equipment for doing scientific tests or for teaching science, or a place where chemicals or medicines are produced

LABORATORY.Defintion: a room or building with scientific equipment for doing scientific tests or for teaching science, or a place where chemicals or medicines are produced

LACES.Defintion: a string that you use to fasten openings, especially in shoes, by putting it through two lines of small holes and tying the ends together

MELTED.Defintion: having turned soft or into a liquid

MIRACLE.Defintion: an unusual and mysterious event that is thought to have been caused by a god because it does not follow the usual laws of nature

PATENT.Defintion: the official legal right to make or sell an invention for a particular number of years

PATENTS.Defintion: the official legal right to make or sell an invention for a particular number of years

PILOT.Defintion: to test a new product before it is sold

RADAR.Defintion: a system that uses radio waves to find the position of objects that cannot be seen

RELUCTANT.Defintion: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it

SCRATCHED.Defintion: to cut or damage a surface or your skin slightly with or on something sharp or rough

SIDE-EFFECT.Defintion: an unpleasant effect of a drug that happens in addition to the main effect

STUMBLE.Defintion: to discover or find something or someone by chance

STUMBLED ACROSS.Defintion: to discover or find something or someone by chance

SYNTHETIC.Defintion: Synthetic products are made from artificial substances, often copying a natural product

TIGHTEN.Defintion: to become tighter or to make something become tighter, firmer, or less easy to move

UNCONVENTIONAL.Defintion: different from what is usual or from the way most people do things

UNORTHODOX.Defintion: different from what is usual or expected in behaviour, ideas, methods, etc.

WORKSHOP.Defintion: a room or building where things are made or repaired using machines and/or tools
